fields.summary: PCR416 - PRB 12 - Short key for copy doesn't work
fields.description_text:
The short key for copy is Crtl C, but if I select a line to copy and press Ctr+C nothing happens.

If this is not possible it's fine for me to remove the text Ctrl+C.

 

Ctrl+N works fine

!image-2021-01-15-12-49-53-891.png!

fields.summary: PCR416 - PRB 12 - Short key for copy doesn't work

comments.body:
Hi [~degrootm],

I think that the problem with the short key CTRL + C is that interferes with a predefined shortcut for other actions. 

So, for example, if I change the menu option to Duplicate with the shortcut CTRL + D it works correctly.

Do you agree to change the menu option and shortcut for "Duplicate" and CTRL + D ? Or do you prefer any other combination of menu option - shortcut? 

Best regards,

Daniel
comments.body_text:
Hi [~degrootm],

I think that the problem with the short key CTRL + C is that interferes with a predefined shortcut for other actions. 

So, for example, if I change the menu option to Duplicate with the shortcut CTRL + D it works correctly.

Do you agree to change the menu option and shortcut for "Duplicate" and CTRL + D ? Or do you prefer any other combination of menu option - shortcut? 

Best regards,

Daniel

comments.body:
Hi [~tenderod]

If we can get it working with another shortcut it's fine for me to change it.

Kind regards

Michel
comments.body_text:
Hi [~tenderod]

If we can get it working with another shortcut it's fine for me to change it.

Kind regards

Michel

comments.body:
Hi [~degrootm],

Please install PNSOAUTDIS 1 EOB.

It should also solve REV8-70615 and REV8-70616.

Please let me know if al works as expected.

Best regards,

Daniel
comments.body_text:
Hi [~degrootm],

Please install PNSOAUTDIS 1 EOB.

It should also solve REV8-70615 and REV8-70616.

Please let me know if al works as expected.

Best regards,

Daniel

comments.body:
Hi [~tenderod]

It is now working as expected.

Kind regards

Michel
comments.body_text:
Hi [~tenderod]

It is now working as expected.

Kind regards

Michel
